# Copilot Instructions for website-template

## Repository Overview
This is a website template repository designed to serve as a starting point for building websites. It provides a basic structure and configuration that can be customized for specific projects.

## Code Style and Conventions
- Follow consistent naming conventions throughout the codebase
- Use clear, descriptive variable and function names
- Keep code modular and maintainable
- Add comments for complex logic or non-obvious implementations

## Development Workflow
1. Create feature branches from the main branch
2. Make small, incremental commits with clear messages
3. Test changes locally before pushing
4. Submit pull requests for code review

## File Organization
- Keep related files organized in appropriate directories
- Use clear directory names that reflect their contents
- Maintain a clean project structure

## Best Practices
- Write clean, readable code
- Follow DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) principles
- Test thoroughly before committing
- Document significant changes in commit messages
- Keep dependencies up to date

## When Contributing
- Review existing code to understand patterns and conventions
- Maintain consistency with the existing codebase
- Ask questions if anything is unclear
- Be respectful and constructive in code reviews
